parameters: \pop[2]As soon as we enter The Wayfarer, we're asked to show our ID.
\pop[2]Of course, we all oblige; except for Isaac and Kyron.
\pop[2]I can see that their infiltration was already successful.
\pop[2]The security guard gives us a nod as we each scan our phones.
\pop[2]A picture of our face and name pops up, which he compares to us in person.
\pop[2]Obviously we pass, and a few moments later, we're officially in.
\pop[2]It's an interesting sight, seeing Isaac and Kyron sitting at a table.
\pop[2]A \c[10]zero\c[0] breaking bread with city folk. Is this how things were before \c[17]Komorebi\c[0]?
\pop[2]Back then, before \c[23]The System\c[0], everybody could've existed in unity.
\pop[2]Of course, that's just wishful thinking. I know the truth.
\pop[2]The world was on the brink of all-out war before the visions came.
\pop[2]I guess there will always be conflict and social divides, no matter what.
\pop[2]It's almost like we're fixated on our need to be different, or superior.
\pop[2]At least that's the way \c[23]Argus\c[0] thinks. Making the \c[10]zeros\c[0] grovel in the streets...
\pop[2]I would never look down on Kyron, and even public opinion supports the \c[10]zeros\c[0].
\pop[2]Perhaps we're approaching unity, for the first time in history.
\pop[2]The sight before me only enforces that this peace is attainable.
\pop[3]We're not living in the fast lane like you.
\pop[2]We all pull our a chair and sit down at the table.
\pop[2]We all nod, implying that it's time for Kyron to go.
\pop[2]If he ordered, and got ID'd successfully, then we'd be in the clear.
\pop[2]It feels like such a risky play, but Isaac's confidence is contagious.
If you're pranking me, I'm gonna get you back.
\pop[2]He leaves the table and starts walking toward the bar.
\pop[3]He sure likes to joke about \c[23]Argus\c[0] killing us, huh?
\pop[3]Joking about serious stuff is a valid way to cope.
\pop[3]Yeah, I said valid, not the best.
I don't mind my life being used as a punchline.
\pop[3]That is the most "Isaac" thing you've ever said.
\pop[2]Klace is looking down at his diary, but keeping it turned away from us.
\pop[2]I can see his eyes scanning the pages, like he's catching up on notes.
Are you sure you didn't notice anything weird about it?
Did you check out my profile?
Wouldn't want you seeing all the mischief I get up to.
\pop[2]We all look at each other for a moment, thinking the exact same thing.
I know it's definitely not Klace.
Unless you want to tell us \c[14]your\c[0] real name, too.
\pop[2]I guess Dante isn't his real name, either...?
\pop[2]Oh well, I'll still call him by his chosen name.
\pop[2]They offer the same courtesy by calling me Delta, after all.
\pop[3]I guess I was just curious what you saw.
Did it flag me as my real account, or my burner account?
\pop[2]He scribbles down some notes in his diary.
\pop[2]It's so interesting how lost he seems to be in that thing.
\pop[2]If I didn't know any better, I'd actually find it a little suspicious.
\pop[2]As a small silence ensues, I decide to ask him about it.
You know, so I can look back one day.
\pop[3]Maybe we could take some pictures or videos?
\pop[3]Well, those can be spread all over the place.
This is strictly private. For my eyes only.
\pop[3]He's probably writing about how annoying we are.
\pop[2]Before the conversation continues, Kyron returns with a tray.
\pop[2]As he places it down on the table, I get my first look at the screwdrivers.
\pop[2]They were barely even orange. It's like, a glass of vodka and a splash of juice.
\pop[3]Heh. I told you they don't mind pouring extra.
\pop[4]Yeah. Guess I'm off the deep end, here.
\pop[2]He grabs his glass, and holds it up with a smile.
